name: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: A classic novel set in the fictional town of Maycomb, Alabama, during the Great Depression.
author: Harper Lee

description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian regime, where individualism is suppressed and government surveillance is omnipresent.
author: George Orwell

name: The Great Gatsby
description: Set in the Roaring Twenties, the novel explores themes of decadence, idealism, and the American Dream.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

name: Pride and Prejudice
description: A romantic novel that follows the emotional development of protagonist Elizabeth Bennet as she navigates issues of manners, upbringing, morality, education, and marriage in the society of the landed gentry of the British Regency.
author: Jane Austen

name: To the Lighthouse
description: A novel that centers on the Ramsay family and their visits to the Isle of Skye in Scotland between 1910 and 1920.
author: Virginia Woolf

name: Moby-Dick
description: An epic tale of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest for revenge against the great white whale that maimed him.
author: Herman Melville

name: The Catcher in the Rye
description: A controversial novel that follows 16-year-old Holden Caulfield after his expulsion from prep school, as he searches for truth and rails against the 'phoniness' of the adult world.
author: J.D. Salinger

name: The Lord of the Rings
description: An epic high-fantasy novel that follows the quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

name: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
description: The first novel in the Harry Potter series, which follows the adventures of a young wizard, Harry Potter, and his friends Hermione Granger and Ron Weasley.
author: J.K. Rowling

name: The Hobbit
description: A fantasy novel about the adventures of the hobbit Bilbo Baggins as he embarks on a quest to reclaim a treasure guarded by the dragon Smaug.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
